alert.note: Alert for Allen; Huntington; Kosciusko; Noble; Wabash; Wells; Whitley (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Allen, Wabash, southwestern Noble, Whitley, Huntington, eastern Kosciusko and northern Wells Counties through 430 AM EDT... At 300 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Andrews, or near Huntington, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Huntington around 305 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Churubusco and Huntertown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 469 between mile markers 0 and 30. Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 272 and 317. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Allen; Huntington; Kosciusko; Noble; Wabash; Wells; Whitley
